questions.question_text: In which form of attack is alternate encoding, such as hexadecimal representation, most often observed?

discussion.content: Cross site scripting (also known as XSS) occurs when a web application gathers malicious data from a user. The data is usually gathered in the form of a hyperlink which contains malicious content within it. The user will most likely click on this link from another website, instant message, or simply just reading a web board or email message. Usually the attacker will encode the malicious portion of the link to the site in HEX (or other encoding methods) so the request is less suspicious looking to the user when clicked on. For example the code below is written in hex: Click Here is equivalent to: Click Here Note: In the format “&#xhhhh“, hhhh is the code point in hexadecimal form

C. cross-site scripting

Cross-site scripting (XSS) is a type of security vulnerability typically found in web applications, that allows an attacker to inject malicious code into a web page viewed by other users. One of the methods attackers use to evade detection and make the injected code more difficult to detect is by using alternate encoding, such as hexadecimal representation. This makes the code harder to read and understand, making it more difficult to detect and remove. This technique is often used in XSS attacks as it allows attackers to hide the malicious code and evade detection by security software and systems.
It could be C but why not D?
not sure about the correct answer for this Q

There are some common characters sets that are used in Web applications attacks. For example, Path Traversal attacks use ../ (dot-dot-slash) , while XSS attacks use < and > characters. These characters give a hexadecimal representation that differs from normal data.
https://owasp.org/www-community/Double_Encoding

comments.content: A and B are wrong as related to ICMP or related network attacks

discussion.content: Would somebody be able to explain why the answer is Cross Side Scripting please?

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What does the number 15 represent in this configuration?

choices.B: access list that identifies the SNMP devices that can access the router
choices.C: interval in seconds between SNMPv3 authentication attempts
choices.D: number of possible failed attempts until the SNMPv3 user is locked out
choices.A: privilege level for an authorized user to this router

choices.B: EPP focuses primarily on threats that have evaded front-line defenses that entered the environment.
choices.A: Having an EDR solution gives an engineer the capability to flag offending files at the first sign of malicious behavior.
choices.D: EDR focuses solely on prevention at the perimeter.
choices.C: Having an EPP solution allows an engineer to detect, investigate, and remediate modern threats.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between EPP and EDR?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
If you do your research B & C is correct.

comments.content: Agree to C and D. Improved Access Management makes more sense as this access is not only related to remote login

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Why not C and D? Secure Remote Access????

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of adaptive multifactor authentication? (Choose two.)

The security team has installed a Cisco Secure Email Gateway. During setup, a large number of email messages containing the string "abcde1111111111" are being blocked. The security team wants to investigate and determine if the emails are part of a phishing or malware attack. Which configuration step must the security team apply?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct:
In ESA create a Message Filter for Logging Suspicious Emails and specify 'quarantine'. Apply the filter to inbound emails

choices.B: Apply a policy to route all blocked emails to a separate quarantine folder.
choices.D: Configure a policy to disable spam filtering in order to expedite email delivery.
choices.C: Configure sender domain reputation policy to check if sender email domain is known to be malicious.
choices.A: Implement a policy to only allow email from trusted to the network senders.
